net.sourceforge.JDash.gui
Class DigitalGauge

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AbstractGauge
      net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.DigitalGauge
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class DigitalGauge
extends AbstractGauge

This is a basic digital gauge. A gigital gauge will display text on the screen.

DigitalGauge

public DigitalGauge(Parameter p,
                    GaugePanel parentPanel,
                    TextShape textShape)
Create a new digital gauges.

Parameters:
p - IN - the parameter to display values for.
parentPanel - IN - the parent gauge panel.
textShape - IN - the text shape object this gauge will display.
Method Detail

enableLowHighHold

public void enableLowHighHold(boolean lowOrHigh)
Enable the hold feature of this guage. Rather than display the current value, the high or low values will be displayed.

Parameters:
lowOrHigh - IN - false will cause this gauge to be a "low" holding gauge. True will make it a high holding gauge. use diableLowHighHold() to disable this feature.

disableLowHighHold

public void disableLowHighHold()
Disable the low high hold feature.

getTextShape

public TextShape getTextShape()
Get the text shape that was used to create this gauge.

Returns:
the text shape.

preGenerate

public java.awt.Rectangle preGenerate(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform scalingTransform,
                                      boolean force)
Override

Specified by:
preGenerate in class AbstractGauge
Parameters:
scalingTransform - IN - the scaling transform that will be passed into the paint() method.
force - IN - force a preGen. In other words, when this is set, you should NOT be returning a null rect.
Returns:
the bounds rectangle. If a null is returned, then this gaugae will not cause a repaint. It will be assumed that a null means that nothing has changed, and a redraw is not needed.
See Also:
net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AbstractGauge#getBounds()

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                  java.awt.geom.AffineTransform scalingTransform)
Override the paint method so we can draw the gauge.

Specified by:
paint in class AbstractGauge
Parameters:
g2 - IN - the graphics context to draw with.
scalingTransform - IN - the tranform to apply that will adjust to the size of the parent panel. This is the same transform that would be returned if calling getParent().getScalingTransform()
See Also:
Component.paint(java.awt.Graphics)
